result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerard P Streator was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 89 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No Contact with any of the victims, Kohls Store or Waukesha Public Library. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 89 days were granted. Concurrent with count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1
Court costs on Count 2 were waived.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Gerard P Streator in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 dismissed and read in.  Cases 14CF482, 14CM605 and 14CM1299 dismissed and read in to this matter.  Clerk to send copy of competency evaluation to the institution.

Court orders the following:

Count 1: 
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years).  Credit for 89 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Follow through with recommended treatment/counseling.  No contact with any of the victims, Kohls Store or Waukesha Public Library.  Maintain full-time employment.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

Count 2:
- 6 months jail CONCURRENT with Count 1.  Credit for 89 days.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
